author: mirichmo
body: Users may manually edit the file, so it we should add schema validation to ensure that it conforms to the expected schema.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @mirichmo @Francisco-Gamino do you think this is critical for 6.0.0? What's the work and benefit involved here?

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: Yes, it will be beneficial. The work would be to create the schema and validate the JSON file against it when reading it. I don't expect it to be a huge amount of work, but I haven't investigated it in great detail. The schema also documents the supported values for the configuration file.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Sounds like we should do this, what do you think?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Doesn't seem like a must have for 6.0.0

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Now we have `Test-Json -Schema` and can resolve the issue.

comments.author: ThomasNieto
comments.body: @iSazonov this issue good to close now?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: No, we haven't still the schema. I played a bit with the config file API and it has seem a not very good format from Json API and strong schema points.

title: Add Schema Validation to JsonConfigFileAccessor
